channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Structure Fire; INC#0578; 10:56AM; 2501 W Colorado Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3n44OZl; Eagle Rock; Two story, commercial building with smoke showing. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. #trafficalert Firefighters had to lay the large diameter (4") supply line across Colorado Blvd. LA DOT is responding for traffic control but all drivers are asked to avoid W Colorado Blvd from Sumner Ave to College View Ave.; FS 42; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC2 E202 E212 E42 E55 RA55 T12 T2; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

Jumper; INC#0507; 10:34AM; 501 W Chavez Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/39wf83i; Downtown; Firefighters have inflated the air rescue cushions while LAPD is speaking with the patient threatening to jump. Commuters are advised to avoid the area. #trafficalert; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 E1 E203 E209 E227 E250 E4 E9 EM11 RA17 RA3 RA4 T27 T3 T50; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1518; 09:05PM; 1755 N Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3neiH7u; Lincoln Heights; KNOCKDOWN: Firefighters making an interior attack from the rear of the building were able to quickly reach and extinguish the bulk of the fire which was primarily on a mezzanine. While there were reports of occupants possibly still in the building, firefighters conducted a primary and secondary search, finding the structure empty. One 51yo male patient was transported in critical condition (the patient was already outside of the building upon LAFD arrival). Per protocol for a significant fire related injury, LAFD Arson is responding for the investigation. A total of over 100 firefighters on scene with knockdown achieved in 35 minutes.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E15 E2 E201 E203 E210 E227 E235 E27 E4 E44 E55 EA1 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA1 RA27 RA3 RA47 RA55 RA801 RA827 RA844 SQ21 T1 T10 T27 T3 T35 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#1518; 08:50PM; 1755 N Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3neiH7u; Lincoln Heights; With 13 fire companies assigned to the incident, it is at the Greater Alarm status. The building is approximately 200' x 75' with an arched truss roof DBA a movie studio. While fire attack made entry through the Alpha (address side) of the building, they made it about half way into the structure without yet locating the fire (operating under zero visibility conditions). Access to the rear (Charlie) side of the building was delayed due to equipment/vehicles surrounding the building. Firefighters now located at the Charlie side can see the fire at the rear of the building and the Incident Commander is coordinating fire attack so those crews which made entry from the Alpha side retreat so fire attack can begin from the Charlie side without creating opposing handlines.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E15 E2 E201 E203 E210 E227 E235 E27 E4 E44 E55 EA1 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA1 RA27 RA3 RA47 RA55 RA801 RA827 RA844 SQ21 T1 T10 T27 T3 T35 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1518; 08:30PM; 1755 N Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3neiH7u; Lincoln Heights; One story commercial building with heavy smoke showing and people outside the building (unknown if there are any patients at this time). Two additional task forces requested. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC2 E1 E201 E4 EM1 RA1 SQ21 T1; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0080; 02:46AM; 3011 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JXo5Vh; Historic South-Central; KNOCKDOWN: 106 firefighters extinguished the fire in one hour and 15 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire unit is a total loss with most of the roof collapsed into the structure. Per protocol, LAFD Arson is on scene for the cause investigation. PIO Captain Weireter is responding for media availability ETA 3:15AM - media staging area will be established upon his arrival. No further details.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E203 E21 E210 E215 E221 E226 E235 E26 E3 E33 E46 E66 EA1 EM1 EM11 HE2 HR3 PI3 RA14 RA15 RA246 RS3 SQ21 T10 T15 T21 T26 T3 T35 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0080; 01:58AM; 3011 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JXo5Vh; Historic South-Central; Due to the amount of fire in the structure and the difficulty reaching the seat of the fire (possible mezzanine which poses great risk with fire above the firefighters on interior attack), the incident commander directed a transition to a Defensive operation. All firefighters are exiting the building and coming off the roof to deploy large diameter, master streams (ladder pipes and 2 1/2" handlines). There are no additional structures exposed at this time and no injuries reported.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E203 E21 E210 E215 E226 E26 E3 E46 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA14 RA15 SQ21 T10 T15 T26 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0080; 01:31AM; 3011 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JXo5Vh; Historic South-Central; 100' x 200' commercial building with smoke showing upon LAFD arrival. Firefighters are in the offensive mode with interior fire attack approximately 100' deep inside the structure still working to locate the fire (possible mezzanine). The truck companies on the roof have at least two ventilation holes cut with heavy fire coming from the holes. Additional resources were requested (reflected in this alert) raising this to the Greater Alarm status.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E203 E21 E210 E215 E226 E26 E3 E46 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA14 RA15 SQ21 T10 T15 T26 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1403; 06:59PM; 9105 N De Garmo Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ncCEvv; Sun Valley; KNOCKDOWN: LA DWP cut off all power to the structure to ensure it is de-energized and firefighters were able to safely make entry and fully extinguish the fire (trash fire in the electrical room only). The fire did not extend into the structure and there are no injuries reported. No further details.; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC12 E260 E289 E298 E60 E77 E89 RA98 T60 T89 T98; CH9; 18; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1403; 06:48PM; 9105 N De Garmo Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ncCEvv; Sun Valley; One story (50' x 50') commercial building with an electrical panel visibly arcing (high voltage). The arcing ignited trash on the floor of the room which firefighters carefully extinguished, ensuring they did not apply water to any electrical components. LA DWP is enroute to safely de-energize the building so firefighters can then make entry and fully extinguish any remaining fire. There is currently no extension to the structure itself and no other structures are threatened. No injuries reported. The original 9-1-1 call (6:05PM) came in as a Transformer fire and was then upgraded to a Structure fire. ; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC12 E260 E289 E298 E60 E77 E89 RA98 T60 T89 T98; CH9; 18; Margaret Stewart
